thread.title: Tourists head for Iran as relations warm (VIDEO)
thread.title_full: Tourists head for Iran as relations warm (VIDEO)

title: Tourists head for Iran as relations warm (VIDEO)
text:
Tourists head for Iran as relations warm (VIDEO) Wednesday August 26, 2015 
NEW YORK, Aug 26 — Buggsie Heath-Brown is planning her summer holiday. 
Somewhere warm, but not where you’d expect. 
News of a nuclear deal and restored diplomatic ties has her packing for Iran. 
Iran hopes that more tourists will make their way there. — Reuters pix Iran hopes Buggsie is part of a trend. It wants to quadruple visitor numbers by 2025. 
The nuclear deal is delivering practical benefits for travellers, and reassurance too. 
Iran has plenty of scope to expand tourism. 
United Nations data show just over 90-thousand arrivals from the EU and North America in 2013. That’s about as many tourists as London gets in two days. 
But tour operator Wild Frontiers says its Iran bookings have soared since the nuclear deal. That could put Teheran on course to meet a goal of quadrupling visitor numbers by 2025. 
Now intrepid travellers have to figure out where to go next if Iran gets less edgy. 
As for Buggsie... she’s already booked a trip to Sudan. — Reuters 
Buggsie Heath-Brown plans to go to Iran for her summer holiday.
